references.paper_title: Structured denoising diffusion models in discrete state-spaces
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundation for the discrete diffusion models in graph generation used in this paper

references.paper_title: Efficient and scalable graph generation through iterative local expansion
references.reason: This paper introduces the main baseline model used for comparison in the experimental section

references.paper_title: Digress: Discrete denoising diffusion for graph generation
references.reason: This paper introduces the main algorithmic framework for graph generation that is extended in this paper

references.paper_title: SPECTRE: Spectral conditioning helps to overcome the expressivity limits of one-shot graph generators
references.reason: This paper introduces a strong baseline model for comparison in the experimental section, especially for the planar datasets

references.paper_title: Tertiary lymphoid structures generation through graph-based diffusion
references.reason: This paper introduces a strong baseline model for comparison in the experimental section, especially for the digital pathology datasets
